page.title: 01CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: This area, situated between the Forest Ridge and the South Downs comprises mostly farmland.It is crossed by several lanes and minor roads,and by two B class roads,Staplefield to Cuck- field and Balcombe to Cuckfield. The river Ouse,about three metres wide here,crosses this part of Sussex and eventually reaches the sea at Newhaven.This is a pleasant and popul- ar residential district,being mid-way between London and the South Coast,and six miles from Crawley New Town,with its modern shops and industrial sites. There is one small village called Brook Street where there is a large workshop for the repair and maintainace of cars and farm machinery As well as cultivated fields and graz- ing land,trees are quite numerous, mostly oak,beech,ash and conifers.
